pull.title: test: Rework wallet_migration.py to use previous releases
pull.body:
This PR reworks wallet_migration.py to use previous releases to produce legacy wallets for testing so that the test will continue to work once legacy wallets are removed.

Split from #28710

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/31248.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#31250](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31250) (wallet: Disable creating and loading legacy wallets by achow101)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

events.message:
wallet: Check specified wallet exists before migration

The previous error message for non-existent wallets of "Already a
descriptor wallet" is misleading. Return a more specific error when a
non-existent wallet is specified.
test: Rework migratewallet to use previous releases

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -82,13 +76,48 @@ def assert_addr_info_equal(self, addr_info, addr_info_old):
         assert_equal(addr_info["hdmasterfingerprint"], addr_info_old["hdmasterfingerprint"])
 
     def assert_list_txs_equal(self, received_list_txs, expected_list_txs):
-        for d in received_list_txs:
-            if "parent_descs" in d:
-                del d["parent_descs"]
-        for d in expected_list_txs:
-            if "parent_descs" in d:
-                del d["parent_descs"]
-        assert_equal(received_list_txs, expected_list_txs)
+        # Filter out the specific fields to compare as this has changed between versions
+        # so direct comparison does not always work.
+        allowed_fields = {
+            "address",
+            "amount",
+            "bip125-replaceable",
+            "confirmations",
+            "blockhash",
+            "blockheight",
+            "blockindex",
+            "blocktime",
+            "category",
+            "confirmations",
+            "label",
+            "time",
+            "timereceived",
+            "txid",
+            "vout",
+            "walletconflicts",
+            "wtxid",
+        }
+        sanitized_txs = []
+        for txs in [received_list_txs, expected_list_txs]:
+            sanitized = []
+            for d in txs:
+                tx = {}
+                for k in d.keys():
+                    if k in allowed_fields:
+                        tx[k] = d[k]
+                sanitized.append(tx)
+            sanitized_txs.append(sanitized)
+        assert_equal(sanitized_txs[0], sanitized_txs[1])
+
+    def assert_descriptors_equal(self, a, b):
+        a = a.split("#")[0].replace("'", "h")
+        b = b.split("#")[0].replace("'", "h")
+        assert_equal(a, b)
+
+    def assert_balances_equal(self, a, b):
+        a.pop("lastprocessedblock", None)
+        b.pop("lastprocessedblock", None)
+        assert_equal(a, b)
comments.body: I wonder if this diff can be removed by just using 28 as the previous release, with the `-deprecatedrpc=create_bdb` option enabled?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -82,13 +76,48 @@ def assert_addr_info_equal(self, addr_info, addr_info_old):
         assert_equal(addr_info["hdmasterfingerprint"], addr_info_old["hdmasterfingerprint"])
 
     def assert_list_txs_equal(self, received_list_txs, expected_list_txs):
-        for d in received_list_txs:
-            if "parent_descs" in d:
-                del d["parent_descs"]
-        for d in expected_list_txs:
-            if "parent_descs" in d:
-                del d["parent_descs"]
-        assert_equal(received_list_txs, expected_list_txs)
+        # Filter out the specific fields to compare as this has changed between versions
+        # so direct comparison does not always work.
+        allowed_fields = {
+            "address",
+            "amount",
+            "bip125-replaceable",
+            "confirmations",
+            "blockhash",
+            "blockheight",
+            "blockindex",
+            "blocktime",
+            "category",
+            "confirmations",
+            "label",
+            "time",

+            "walletconflicts",

+        sanitized_txs = []

+        a.pop("lastprocessedblock", None)
+        b.pop("lastprocessedblock", None)
+        assert_equal(a, b)

@@ -487,46 +498,23 @@ def test_encrypted(self):
 
         assert_equal(bals, wallet.getbalances())
 
-    def test_unloaded(self):
-        self.log.info("Test migration of a wallet that isn't loaded")
-        wallet = self.create_legacy_wallet("notloaded")
-        default = self.nodes[0].get_wallet_rpc(self.default_wallet_name)
-
-        addr = wallet.getnewaddress()
-        txid = default.sendtoaddress(addr, 1)
-        self.generate(self.nodes[0], 1)
-        bals = wallet.getbalances()
-
-        wallet.unloadwallet()
-
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "RPC endpoint wallet and wallet_name parameter specify different wallets", wallet.migratewallet, "someotherwallet")
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Either RPC endpoint wallet or wallet_name parameter must be provided", self.nodes[0].migratewallet)
comments.body:
Looks like this coverage should be preserved?

See also https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/31248

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -487,46 +498,23 @@ def test_encrypted(self):
 
         assert_equal(bals, wallet.getbalances())
 
-    def test_unloaded(self):
-        self.log.info("Test migration of a wallet that isn't loaded")
-        wallet = self.create_legacy_wallet("notloaded")
-        default = self.nodes[0].get_wallet_rpc(self.default_wallet_name)
-
-        addr = wallet.getnewaddress()
-        txid = default.sendtoaddress(addr, 1)
-        self.generate(self.nodes[0], 1)
-        bals = wallet.getbalances()
-
-        wallet.unloadwallet()
-
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "RPC endpoint wallet and wallet_name parameter specify different wallets", wallet.migratewallet, "someotherwallet")
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-8, "Either RPC endpoint wallet or wallet_name parameter must be provided", self.nodes[0].migratewallet)
comments.body: Done. Also added a test for non-existent wallets and this uncovered a bug.
